The ravioli in the image has a slightly crispy, cheesy topping, suggesting it's been baked or fried, with a golden, slightly toasted surface.	<>	Ravioli, a stuffed pasta dish, is made by folding thin dough sheets over a mixture of cheese, herbs, and spices, then cooking it by boiling or baking until the dough is tender and the filling is melted and flavorful, typically appearing as small, square or triangular pastries with a golden, crispy exterior when served.	<>	Ravioli is a pasta dish made by filling small, square-shaped pasta sheets with ingredients like ricotta cheese and spinach, then sealing the edges. It is typically cooked in boiling water and sometimes sautéed or baked with a topping of butter, cheese, and herbs. Visually, it presents a golden-brown, slightly crispy exterior, often served on a white plate.	<>	The ravioli is a golden-brown, crispy dish, likely made with spinach and cheese, cooked by frying.
